Mapcolonies : Mapproxy Authentication Usage Examples

Created by shimonc1, last modified by Tal Zmiri on Mar 09, 2022

Below examples will include “http://localhost:8080” as host url

Do not forget to change the url to our real host url

Map Component

On web clients, when using a Map Component such as Cesium for example, you will need to supply your token in a custom header x-api-key as such:

const wmts = new Cesium.WebMapTileServiceImageryProvider({
  url: new Cesium.Resource({
    url: "http://localhost:8080/wmts/<layer_name>/{TileMatrixSet}/{TileMatrix}/{TileCol}/{TileRow}.png",
    headers: {
      "x-api-key": "<token>",
    }
  }),
  layers: "<layer_name>",
  style: "default",
  format: "image/png",
  tileMatrixSetID: "<grid_name>",
  tilingScheme: new Cesium.GeographicTilingScheme()
});

const viewer = new Cesium.Viewer("cesiumcontainer", {
  imageryProvider: wmts,
  sceneMode: Cesium.SceneMode.COLUMBUS_VIEW,
  mapProjection: new Cesium.GeographicProjection(),
  baseLayerPicker: false,
});

Map Component view when the token isn’t supplied (all requests get status code 403):

When the token is supplied:

cesium documentation regarding WMTS layer - https://cesium.com/learn/cesiumjs/ref-doc/WebMapTileServiceImageryProvider.html?classFilter=We

cesium documentation regarding WMTS layer URL (Resource | String) as Resource https://cesium.com/learn/cesiumjs/ref-doc/Resource.html

Read more about MapColonies authentication: Authentication
